title.native: カードファイト!! ヴァンガード Divinez

description:
One day, six cards known as the "Six Desires" were born with the power to change fate.
Six fighters were chosen, and would come to possess those six cards. What awaited them was the “Fated Clash“, where they would fight each other until the end, and the last one standing would have any wish granted. A youth named Akina Myodo, who wants to help his frail sister, participates in the Fated Clash to have his wish granted.

And thus, he throws himself into battles with powerful fighters.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #ヴァンガード #ディヴァインズ

tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

node.description:
Bushiroad Inc. (株式会社ブシロード, Kabushiki-gaisha Bushirōdo) is a Japanese entertainment company producer of collectible card games and trading cards, publisher of mobile apps and games, promotional items and many other venues, which was founded in 2007 by Takaaki Kidani and is headquartered in Tokyo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bushi_PR)

Akira Ito (伊藤 彰, Itō Akira) is a manga artist. Ito drew Yu-Gi-Oh! R while the creator of the Yu-Gi-Oh! franchise, Kazuki Takahashi, came up with the storyline. Ito's drawing style is similar to Takahashi's. Ito later co-created Cardfight!! Vanguard in collaboration with Satoshi Nakamura (technical advisor for Duel Masters) and Bushiroad president Takaaki Kidani, he is also the author of Cardfight!! Vanguard manga and Cardfight!! Vanguard G: THE PROLOGUE, as well as the illustrator/designer of several cards in the Cardfight!! Vanguard game.

[Website](http://www.clamp-net.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CLAMP_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/clamp_4_official/) CLAMP is an all-female Japanese manga artist group that formed in the mid-1980s. It consists of leader [Nanase Ohkawa](https://anilist.co/staff/97292), and three artists who shift roles for each series: [Mokona](https://anilist.co/staff/100802) (もこな), [Tsubaki Nekoi](https://anilist.co/staff/100804), and Satsuki Igarashi (いがらし寒月). Almost 100 million CLAMP tankōbon copies have been sold worldwide as of October 2007. In general, Ohkawa gets her inspiration for the group from everyday events such as dreams or the news. Unlike most manga artists who specialize in a single genre, CLAMP has created a diverse body of work. CLAMP's genres vary widely, from childish and comedic (Cardcaptor Sakura, Clamp School Detectives) to more dramatic and teen-rated (xxxHolic, X) series. Furthermore, drawing from the idea of Osamu Tezuka's Star System as they did in Tsubasa: Reservoir Chronicle, CLAMP often crossover characters from their own series into their other works, which gives rise to a loosely defined "Clamp Universe".

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfiSo8tO3WPU-8YOgr4Ba6g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/vwp_virtual)

**V.W.P**, also known as Virtual Witch Phenomenon is a virtual singer group, signed under the label KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO. The group consists of:

- [KAF](https://anilist.co/staff/168254/Kaf)
- [RIM](https://anilist.co/staff/249497/Rim)
- [ISEKAIIJOUCHO](https://anilist.co/staff/273976/Isekaijoucho)
- [HARUSARUHI](https://anilist.co/staff/262530/Harusaruhi)
- [KOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/250353/Koko)

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@ren_suimin) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ren_suimin)

Composer of Vocaloid songs. Currently affiliated with Kamitsubaki Studio.

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@ren_suimin) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ren_suimin)

Composer of Vocaloid songs. Currently affiliated with Kamitsubaki Studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asuka_oda)

A lyricist affiliated with Elements Garden.

Daisuke Kikuta is a Japanese music composer and arranger.

He is employed at Aria Entertainment and belongs to Elements Garden.

Daisuke Kikuta is a Japanese music composer and arranger.

He is employed at Aria Entertainment and belongs to Elements Garden.

Morfonica is an all-girl band in the BanG Dream! franchise. The group consists of five members:
- [Amane Shindou](https://anilist.co/staff/137843/Amane-Shindou) (as [Mashiro Kurata](https://anilist.co/character/162063/Mashiro-Kurata)) on vocals
- [Hina Suguta](https://anilist.co/staff/136365/Hina-Suguta) (as [Touko Kirigaya](https://anilist.co/character/162062/Touko-Kirigaya)) on guitar
- [Yuuka Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/168298/Yuuka-Nishio) (as [Nanami Hiromachi](https://anilist.co/character/162061/Nanami-Hiromachi)) on bass
- [Mika](https://anilist.co/staff/175301/mika) (as [Tsukushi Futaba](https://anilist.co/character/162065/Tsukushi-Futaba)) on drums
- [Ayasa](https://anilist.co/staff/175302/Ayasa) (as [Rui Yashio](https://anilist.co/character/162064/Rui-Yashio)) on violin

Morfonica is the fourth girls' band of the project to perform live. It was first announced in March 2020, and they debuted with their song "Daylight".

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!
